author: roochenz
body: The two main ETFs were already mentioned.  If you want direct companies, here’s a list off the top of my head: Crowdstrike, Tenable, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Checkpoint, Rapid7, Tenable, Zscaler.

author: ChesterDoraemon
body: The problem as an investor is that you get stuck in an adverse selection.  You often miss out on the gains and only get assigned when the news is significantly worse than you anticipated.  For real world, I earned a few % points in Mar, but missed all the zingers BA, ZM, FTNT, NKE, etc..    But to be honest, at the time I was prepared for assignment but wasn't really looking forward to it, especially BA.

author: ccaiccie
body: Buying on the dips for PANW and FTNT.

author: karma-neutral
body: I heard ISPs are hitting unprecedented sustained bandwidth usage too. CSCO/PANW/FTNT?

author: ccaiccie
body:
Yes, but most companies have the following issues:

1. The VPN appliances they have is not designed to support all users. Cisco for example, requires you to license anyconnect per user. You need to have the correct number of licenses.
2. VPN requires hardware encryption and most companies have just remote workers connecting via VPN not the majority of workers.

Palo Alto has something called prisma access that allows companies to use cloud based VPN. Both Palo Alto and Fortinet can run in cloud to expand the VPN capacity.

Just my 2 cents.
